intro: Couroupita parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered couroupita, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
